page.title: 04THE CANAL
page.content: The stretch of the Great Weston canal which runs though our area opened in 1838 and was closed in 1864.It ran from Taunton through Nynehead, Wellington,Thorn St Margaret, Holcombe Rogus to Tiverton.The narrow boats which transported cargoes of coal, lime stone and stone were only 1.8 meters wide and 6.1 meters long while the canal itself was only 2.1 meters wide. At Thore St Margaret there was an incine where it wasnt possible to build a lock because of the lack of water. A lift was buit instead which consisted of a cage on wheels that carried the boats up the incline.The cage was operated by a steam engine, house in a building at the upper leval.The canal is now filled in but the towpath along which the horses walked that pulled the longboats,still exists as a public path.
